pullRequest.title: Create facesContainer-3.0 Feature
pullRequest.bodyText:
fixes  #14524
fixes #14561
fixes #14563

Investigate weld imports.

Weld Imports are only needed for the ConversationScoped Beans as they are only used in the IBMViewHandlerProxy (ConversationAwareViewHandler) class.
Talked to Andy Guilbert, and he advises it's best to leave the imports alone as the current code works fine.
We could setup inheritance, but our IBMViewHandlerProxy class has one extra line. Maybe WELD can port it to their code?
One potential problem I see is that although ConversationAwareViewHandler is in the WELD package, it implements the  ViewHandlerWrapper from the faces API. For this feature, the developer packages the API within their application. WELD would have to somehow retrieve this class from the application class loader?
This is the exception I faced when trying to remove the weld imports from  com.ibm.ws.jsfContainer:
[10/1/20, 23:00:23:665 EDT] 00000042 webapp        E com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.webapp.WebApp notifyServletContextCreated SRVE0283E: Exception caught while initializing context: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta.faces.application.ViewHandlerWrapper 


Confirm naming of Components
FAT Enablement
If using WELD in com.ibm.ws.jsfContainer, investigate transformation rules for org.jboss.weld.context.http as the version isn't updated currently. Update: Transformation Rule Added

Other than the new feature, the biggest change is the update to FacesUrlTransformer.java & IBMViewHandlerProxy.java.  These files were updated so they are more in sync with the latest WELD code. See https://github.com/weld/core/tree/master/modules/jsf/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/module/jsf
____________________________________________ Update __________________________________________________
CheckSum tests have been implemented in the io.openliberty.org.jboss.weld4 bundle.
Tests check for change in the FacesUrlTransformer & ConversationAwareViewHandler classes if case they ever change.

nodes.bodyText: add WLP-Activation-Type: parallel
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+# This private feature corresponds to using a JSF-providing feature
+# with just a container and no implementation (e.g. jsfContainer-3.0)
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.facesProvider-3.0.0.Container
+singleton=true
+visibility=private
+kind=noship
+edition=core

nodes.bodyText: Update copyright
Let me know I need any other changes to this description.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+###############################################################################
+# Copyright (c) 2018 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials

+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE

+
+description=This feature enables CDI integrations for web applications that use the Jakarta Server Faces \
+ (JSF) 3.0 framework. This feature only includes container integration code for JSF, and does \
+ not include any JSF interfaces or implementation.  To use this feature, JSF interfaces and implementation \
+ must be packaged within web applications that use JSF.

nodes.bodyText:
These files were out of date, so I updated them as part of this new feature. I can undo these changes, and do them in a separate PR if you still want these updates.  (Or I can just create a new issue and link this PR to it).
You can find these files here: https://github.com/weld/core/tree/master/modules/jsf/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/module/jsf
This particular change you commented on was part of WELD-2512 if you look at the commit history.
Correct to classloading30

nodes.bodyText: remove jpa-3.0 as the name has changed

I do understand why this class exists here but we should a) compare it to the most recent Weld 4.0 version and b) see if the Weld guys would be willing to make changes if we need them.
https://github.com/weld/core/blob/master/modules/jsf/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/module/jsf/ConversationAwareViewHandler.java
